cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 45 mi (70 km) ENE of Kingston, Jamaica
cyclone.trajectory: Turning northwest later today, crossing eastern-central Cuba tonight into Monday, then moving across the Florida Straits and paralleling or crossing the west coast of Florida Tuesday-Wednesday

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch only for Cayman Brac/Little Cayman, western Cuba, and portions of the Florida Keys – not the Virgin Islands
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning for Jamaica, southern Haiti and much of eastern and central Cuba – not the Virgin Islands
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Current impacts confined to Jamaica, Haiti and Cuba, expanding toward Florida Straits and the U.S. southeast coast; eastern Caribbean including the Virgin Islands is no longer in the impact zone
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: Not listed (no location in the wind-probability table is near the U.S. Virgin Islands)
weather_observation.wind: No tropical-storm-force winds expected at St. Croix; system has moved well west of the island
weather_observation.rainfall: Showers possible from trailing moisture, but heavy rain associated with Elsa has shifted away; widespread 4-inch totals not expected
